description: Generate walls with specified shapes. The wall shapes include: {box, circle, and point in 2D; box, cone, cylinder, disk, line, plane, point, polygon, and sphere in 3D}. Note: A model domain must be specified prior to wall creation. All wall facets must fall within the model domain. The id, name, and group keywords must be given prior to any additional keywords. While cycling, walls can only be created before cycle point 0 (i.e., when the timestep is calculated).

keywords.name: group
keywords.description: Assign group name s at slot (default: 'Default'). Optional 'facet' keyword assigns to facets instead of wall

keywords.name: id
keywords.description: Wall ID. If not specified, next available ID is used

keywords.name: name
keywords.description: Wall name. If not specified, each shape defines default name with ID appended

keywords.name: box
keywords.description: Generate closed box (z-components 3D only). Default: each side is a separate wall with auto-generated names. If name='mybox' is specified, PFC creates walls named 'myboxTopXX', 'myboxBottomXX', 'myboxLeftXX', 'myboxRightXX', 'myboxFrontXX', 'myboxBackXX' (3D) or 'myboxTopXX', 'myboxBottomXX', 'myboxLeftXX', 'myboxRightXX' (2D), where XX is the wall ID. **Python SDK Access**: Use itasca.wall.find('myboxTopXX') to get each face. **Alternative**: Use 'wall create' for independent control of each face without name concatenation. Use one-wall keyword for single wall. If only fxmin/fxmax given, creates cube. expand: expand each side by factor fe

keywords.name: circle
keywords.description: Generate closed circle (2D only). Default name: circleWall. Default radius: 1.0, resolution: 0.1 (facet length < fres*frad)

keywords.name: cone
keywords.syntax: cone base <v> axis <v> height <fheight> radius <fradbot> <fradtop> cap <bbottom> <btop> resolution <fres> one-wall
keywords.description: Generate cone/frustum (3D only). Default name: coneWall. fradtop>0 creates frustum. Default: separate walls for base/side/top. cap: include end caps (default: bottom only). resolution: edge length < fres*fradbot

keywords.name: cylinder
keywords.syntax: cylinder base <v> axis <v> height <fheight> radius <frad> cap <bbottom> <btop> resolution <fres> one-wall
keywords.description: Generate cylinder (3D only). Default name: cylinderWall. Default: separate walls for top/bottom/side, both caps created. cap: specify end caps. resolution: edge length < fres*frad

keywords.name: disk
keywords.syntax: disk position <v> radius <frad> dip <fdip> dip-direction <fddir> resolution <fres>
keywords.description: Generate disk (3D only). Default name: diskWall. dip: angle [0,90] from dip direction. dip-direction: [0,360] clockwise from +y. Default radius: 1.0, resolution: 0.1

keywords.name: line
keywords.description: Generate line wall (3D only). Made of 2 facets with endpoints v1, v2. resolution: out-of-plane thickness (should be << length)

keywords.name: plane
keywords.description: Generate plane wall spanning entire domain. Default name: planeWall. dip: {[0,180] 2D; [0,90] 3D}. dip-direction: [0,360] (3D only)

keywords.name: point
keywords.description: Generate point wall. Default name: pointWall. {line segment 2D; equilateral triangle 3D}, size << min ball/pebble (1/10th). resolution: {facet length 2D; edge length 3D}, default: 1/100th of min domain side

keywords.name: polygon
keywords.description: Generate planar polygon wall (3D only). Default name: polygonWall. Default mode: convex polygons, any vertex order. triangulate: for convex/concave, ordered vertices. make-planar: snap vertices to plane

keywords.name: sphere
keywords.description: Generate closed sphere (3D only). Generated by refining icosahedron. Default radius: 1.0, resolution: 0.1 (edge length < fres*frad)

examples.description: Generate cube with sides at ±10 (separate walls for each face)
Generate rectangular box as single wall (3D)

examples.command: wall generate cylinder base (0,0,0) axis (0,0,1) height 10 radius 3 cap false true
examples.description: Generate cylinder with no bottom cap, top cap only (3D)

examples.command: wall generate disk radius 5.0 dip 45.0 dip-direction 90.0
examples.description: Generate disk with 45° dip, 90° dip direction (3D)

examples.command: wall generate cone base (-2.5,0,-5) axis (1,1,1) height 2.0 radius 0.1 2.5 cap true true resolution 0.5 one-wall
examples.description: Generate conic frustum as single wall with both caps (3D)

examples.command: wall generate circle position (0,0) radius 3.0 resolution 0.05
examples.description: Generate circle at origin with radius 3.0, fine resolution (2D)

examples.command: wall generate plane position (0,0,10) dip 30 dip-direction 45
examples.description: Generate plane through (0,0,10) with 30° dip at 45° direction (3D)

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('wall generate ...') - Python SDK does not provide wall geometry generation

notes: IMPORTANT: The id, name, and group keywords must be given prior to any additional keywords (shape keywords like box, cylinder, etc.)
This command is designed for generating complete geometric bodies composed of multiple wall elements (e.g., box creates 6 separate walls by default)
For box shape: Each face gets auto-generated name suffix (Top/Bottom/Left/Right/Front/Back + ID)
Python SDK access requires finding each face individually: itasca.wall.find('nameTopXX') where XX is wall ID
For independent control of individual faces with custom names, use 'wall create' instead to avoid name concatenation
